episodes.title: Reading SIX Memoirs On Two Rival LDS Cults
episodes.description:
It's the video that I feel like you have all been waiting for. Finally, I go over the six memoirs about the Church of the Firstborn of the Fulness of Time and its rival Church of the Lamb of God, and how the latter becomes vicious under the leadership of Ervil LeBaron. Within this world of insanity, women grow up, are married off, and raise children in these polygamist cults that seems to only serve the men around them. 

Timestamps:
Introduction: 00:00 - 00:58
Shattered Dreams: 00:59 - 4:09 
Daughters of Zion: A Family's Conversion to Polygamy: 4:10 - 7:21
Favorite Wife: 7:21- 12:41
The Sounds of Gravel: 12:42-17:13
The Polygamist's Daughter: 17:14-21:16
Dad Scares Me God Scares Me: 21:16

Books Referenced - 

LeBaron, Anna. The Polygamist's Daughter. (2017). Tyndale House Publishers.

LaRee, Vera. Dad Scares Me God Scares Me. (2020). Watermark Publishing

Ray, Susan. His Favorite Wife. (2009). Kassidy Lane Pub Llc

Spencer, Irene. Shattered Dreams: My Life as a Polygamist's Wife. (2007). Center Street

Taylor, Kim. Daughters of Zion: A Family's Conversion to Polygamy. (2008). Rogue Hill Publishing LLC

Wariner, Ruth. The Sounds of Gravel. (2016). Flatiron Books
subjects: Church of the First Born of the Lamb of God
The Church Of Jesus Christ Of Latter-Day Saints

episodes.title: I Read SEVEN Memoirs On the FLDS Cult
episodes.description:
None of these books are being sponsored. I did want to provide a list of all the books I used in this video though.

Allred, Sarah. (2018). Give Me Back My Children! 

Jeffs, B., Szalavit, M. (2009). Lost Boy. Broadway Books.

Jeffs, R.. (2017). Breaking free: How I escaped polygamy, the FLDS cult, and my father, Warren Jeffs. Harper Collins. 

Jessop, C. Palmer, L. (2007). Escape. Crown Archetype

Jessop, C., Palmer, Laura. (2010). Triumph: Life After the Cult--A Survivor's Lessons. Crown Archetype.

Musser, R. Cook, M. (2013). The Witness Wore Red: The 19th Wife Who Brought Polygamous Cult Leaders to Justice. Grand Central Publishing.

Wall, E., Pulitzer, Wall. (2008). Stolen Innocence. William Morrow.
